flow.descriptionCdata:
72acb2c8-0fc4-4553-a2eb-1eaad8524939.284af329-6c04-41b3-bf78-5a2f6b9eec1c.description=
This operation loops as many times as specified in the "count" input, counting from "1" to a greater number, incrementing it by "1" at each iteration.

Inputs\:
    count - The number of loops to complete.
Valid values\: from 1 to 9223372036854775807
    reset - Specifies whether the counter restarts counting from "1".
Valid values\: true, false
Default value\: false
    to - The number to count to. It will take the value of the "count" input field. 
    from - The number to start counting at. For this operation, it is customized to "1".
    incrementBy - The number to increment by while counting. For this operation, it is customized to "1".

Results\:
    resultString – This is the primary output. It contains the value of the number that was just counted.

Responses\:
    has more – The counting process is not complete. One or more iterations are pending.
    no more – The counting process is complete.
    failure - The operation completed unsuccessfully.

Note\:
1. It is recommended that you do not change the values of the "to", "from" or "incrementBy" input fields.
2. The "from", "to" and "incrementBy" inputs are customized for this operation. Even though you can also customize them, if you need to specify the loop range borders and the increment value, use the "Counter" operation.

Examples\:
1. For a loop with 20 iterations, the following values should be provided for the input fields\:
    count\: 20
    reset\: false (this field can also be left blank, as "false" is the default value)
2. For an infinite loop, the value of "count" should be at least "1" and the value of "reset" should be "true".
72acb2c8-0fc4-4553-a2eb-1eaad8524939.2a9ff930-8083-4ccb-a20d-06e7337031a1.description=This workflow returns the component properties and values using Artifact APIs. result\: propertyNameValuesList\: pipe separated list of property name and values ( where each property name and values would be ; seprated and multiple values would be , seprated) e.g. - property 1; value1,value2|property 2; value3|property 3; value3,value4|........ 72acb2c8-0fc4-4553-a2eb-1eaad8524939.2cefc458-8f6f-445c-ab73-cded7744c287.prompt=User Identifier 72acb2c8-0fc4-4553-a2eb-1eaad8524939.301a04ee-6a28-4a3b-b026-de2692b11d21.prompt=User Identifier 72acb2c8-0fc4-4553-a2eb-1eaad8524939.4386f9d3-d393-4133-aee3-80a484b4b1d1.description=
This operation waits for the number of seconds specified in the "seconds" input.

Inputs\:
    seconds - The number of seconds to wait.

Results\:
    resultString – This is the primary output. It contains the "completed sleep" message if the operation completed successfully and an error message otherwise. 

Responses\:
    success - The operation completed as stated in the description.
    failure - The operation completed unsuccessfully.
72acb2c8-0fc4-4553-a2eb-1eaad8524939.480396d1-24d7-4230-b05c-8c800e24c5ee.description=
This operation waits for the number of seconds specified in the "seconds" input.

Inputs\:

Results\:
    resultString – This is the primary output. It contains the "completed sleep" message if the operation completed successfully and an error message otherwise. 

Responses\:
    success - The operation completed as stated in the description.
    failure - The operation completed unsuccessfully.

This operation waits for the number of seconds specified in the "seconds" input.

72acb2c8-0fc4-4553-a2eb-1eaad8524939.5145c66b-7a27-4b34-9c0f-2e337047c6b7.description=
Sends an smtp email
 
Input Parameters\:
hostname - hostname or ip address of smtp server
port - port smtp service is listening
from - from email address
to - email address(s) or recipients
subject - email subject
body - body of the email
htmlEmail - true or false, whether the email should be sent supporting html rich email.
readReceipt - true or false, whether or not to request a read receipt
attachments - comma separated list of files to attach (must be full path)
username - if SMTP authentication is needed, the username to send
password - the password to use
characterSet - the character set encoding for the entire email which includes subject, body, attached file name and the attached file. Default value is UTF-8
contentTransferEncoding - the content transfer encoding scheme (such as 7bit, 8bit, base64, quoted-printable etc) for the entire email which includes subject, body, attached file name and the attached file. Default value is - quoted-printable or Q Encoding.
 
 Responses\:
 success - successfully sent the email
 failure - failed to send the email

Note\:
For special characters (East Asian, right-to-left languages, etc.) you must install the support files on your local machine.
	For doing this on Windows go to Control Panel -> Regional and Language Options -> Language and check the options at Supplemental language support.
72acb2c8-0fc4-4553-a2eb-1eaad8524939.66b4e62d-a73a-4291-b657-9041cd044f6f.description=
Pings the target computer from a Windows host computer.

Input Parameters\:
host 		- The hostname or IP address of the host computer to ping from.
user 		- Username to use for remote WMI impersonation and thread impersonation on the RAS host for this operation (can be left blank). The user to authenticate as.
password 		- Password of the user.
target 		- The target computer to ping.
packets 		- The number of packets to send to the target computer.
packetSize 		- The size of packets to send to the target computer.
command 		- DO NOT CHANGE THIS VALUE.
characterSet 	- The character encoding of the target computer. The default is RAS machine's default encoding.
outputPath 		- A network accessible path used by the operation to store temporary files. If not specified it points to \\host\admin$\temp\'. If this path is not accessible it should be changed to use another share that the local system account on the host computer has write-access to. By default, the path must be changed on Windows 2000 computers.

Responses\:
success 		- The target computer responded to all ping requests.
failure 		- The target computer did not respond to any ping request.
diagnosed		- The target computer responded only to some ping requests.
Connection Error	- The host computer could not be found or user credentials supplied to connect to it are incorrect.
Unknown Target	- The target computer could not be resolved to an IP address.

Result\:
The output of the ping operation.

Extra Results\:
returnResult		- The raw output of the Ping operation.
address 		- The actual IP address of the target computer.
% Packet Loss 	- The percentage of packets that ping replies were not received for.
average latency	- The average ping response time in milliseconds.
max latency 		- The maximum response time of all the ping reqeusts (in milliseconds).
min latency 		- The minimum number of milliseconds that was taken to receive a ping response.

Note\: If an encoding is not given by user, the batch file will be created using the RAS machine's default encoding,
That may cause to corruption in a case where remote machine's encoding is different than the RAS machine's one.
In that case,user must define the appropriate 'characterSet'
The character encoding specified in the input for characterSet must not be Unicode (ex. UTF-8, UTF-16).
72acb2c8-0fc4-4553-a2eb-1eaad8524939.68c4317d-aaf2-43a3-a26b-e85e8f308d2e.description=
Sends an smtp email
 
Input Parameters\:
hostname - hostname or ip address of smtp server
port - port smtp service is listening
from - from email address
to - email address(s) or recipients
subject - email subject
body - body of the email
htmlEmail - true or false, whether the email should be sent supporting html rich email.
readReceipt - true or false, whether or not to request a read receipt
attachments - comma separated list of files to attach (must be full path)
username - if SMTP authentication is needed, the username to send
password - the password to use
characterSet - the character set encoding for the entire email which includes subject, body, attached file name and the attached file. Default value is UTF-8
contentTransferEncoding - the content transfer encoding scheme (such as 7bit, 8bit, base64, quoted-printable etc) for the entire email which includes subject, body, attached file name and the attached file. Default value is - quoted-printable or Q Encoding.
 
 Responses\:
 success - successfully sent the email
 failure - failed to send the email

Note\:
For special characters (East Asian, right-to-left languages, etc.) you must install the support files on your local machine.
	For doing this on Windows go to Control Panel -> Regional and Language Options -> Language and check the options at Supplemental language support.

72acb2c8-0fc4-4553-a2eb-1eaad8524939.831c38b3-c83b-4739-ad20-69f07dd25f45.prompt=Process Instance ID 72acb2c8-0fc4-4553-a2eb-1eaad8524939.88ae55d0-aab1-4e4c-9904-f3195316d7f3.description=This workflow updates the Process Instance State using PEM API. Inputs\: _PROCESS_INSTANCE_ID - Process Instance Id _processInstanceState - Process Instance State (Use value from selection list CSA-ProcessInstance-State) Result\: _processInstanceState -Updated Process Instance State 72acb2c8-0fc4-4553-a2eb-1eaad8524939.8a83e6c5-66b1-42cf-9cf7-53bd4a1ec2c2.description=This workflow adds/ updates the component properties to Instance using Artifact APIs. onlyUpdate\: yes/no yes - To update values of existing properties no - To add and/or update properties keyValuePairs\: If you want to Add/update new properties\: property1 PUBLIC INTEGER 5 property2 PUBLIC STRING abc xyz If you want to only update the values of existing properties\: property1 5 property2 abc xyz 72acb2c8-0fc4-4553-a2eb-1eaad8524939.8d17efd1-b31b-49cb-9c5d-f6627cfb1e7e.prompt=User Identifier 72acb2c8-0fc4-4553-a2eb-1eaad8524939.bad8f125-e0f7-4639-b383-dc5b8be57ee4.description=This workflow updates the Process Instance State using PEM API. Inputs\: _PROCESS_INSTANCE_ID - Process Instance Id _processInstanceState - Process Instance State (Use value from selection list CSA-ProcessInstance-State) Result\: _processInstanceState -Updated Process Instance State 72acb2c8-0fc4-4553-a2eb-1eaad8524939.bb796c06-aa7d-408b-918d-257f2d26ca2c.prompt=Component ID 72acb2c8-0fc4-4553-a2eb-1eaad8524939.bce5e50f-cc86-4445-ac4c-33b980755d18.description=
Sends an smtp email
 
Input Parameters\:
hostname - hostname or ip address of smtp server
port - port smtp service is listening
from - from email address
to - email address(s) or recipients
subject - email subject
body - body of the email
htmlEmail - true or false, whether the email should be sent supporting html rich email.

contentTransferEncoding - the content transfer encoding scheme (such as 7bit, 8bit, base64, quoted-printable etc) for the entire email which includes subject, body, attached file name and the attached file. Default value is - quoted-printable or Q Encoding.
 
 Responses\:

Note\:

72acb2c8-0fc4-4553-a2eb-1eaad8524939.c4b654a4-c85a-46f8-ac20-d72f7a5903da.description=
This operation checks whether a string matches another string, using a specific matching rule. The "toMatch" input is the string that is checked for matching the "matchTo" expression. 

Inputs\:
    matchType - The type of match to perform.
Valid values\: Exact Match, Contains, Contains Once, Does Not Contain, Match All Words, Match No Words, Regex
Default value\: Exact Match
    toMatch - The string that is checked for matching.
    matchTo - The string to match against.
Example\: If "matchType" is “RegEx”, the "matchTo" input is a regular expression such as\: ^-?\d+(([\.,]\d+)?)+$. 
    ignoreCase - Specifies whether to ignore case when matching or not.
Valid values\: False, True
Default value\: False

Results\:
    returnResult - This is the primary output. It contains the string "Matches" if the "toMatch" string matches the "matchTo" string. Otherwise, it contains the string "Does Not Match".  

Responses\:
    success - The operation completed as stated in the description.
    failure - The operation completed unsuccessfully.
72acb2c8-0fc4-4553-a2eb-1eaad8524939.c5d1f623-74ab-4276-b81e-58ac4d4016af.description=
This operation checks whether a string matches another string, using a specific matching rule. The "toMatch" input is the string that is checked for matching the "matchTo" expression. 

Inputs\:
    matchType - The type of match to perform.
Valid values\: Exact Match, Contains, Contains Once, Does Not Contain, Match All Words, Match No Words, Regex
Default value\: Exact Match
    toMatch - The string that is checked for matching.
    matchTo - The string to match against.
Example\: If "matchType" is “RegEx”, the "matchTo" input is a regular expression such as\: ^-?\d+(([\.,]\d+)?)+$. 
    ignoreCase - Specifies whether to ignore case when matching or not.
Valid values\: False, True
Default value\: False

Results\:
    returnResult - This is the primary output. It contains the string "Matches" if the "toMatch" string matches the "matchTo" string. Otherwise, it contains the string "Does Not Match".  

Responses\:
    success - The operation completed as stated in the description.
    failure - The operation completed unsuccessfully.

72acb2c8-0fc4-4553-a2eb-1eaad8524939.cd7effd3-aa86-41d8-95ec-696c3aa2b894.prompt=Resource Provider ID 72acb2c8-0fc4-4553-a2eb-1eaad8524939.description=
Start a VPC server, 

The creds must be passed in the xml request, so they are extracted from the resource provider
Calls the VPC  server webservice, and passes the action string start
and sets subscription  power stat 


Inputs Parameters\:

 CSA_CONTEXT_ID – CSA Context Id
 CSA_PROCESS_ID – CSA Process Instance Id
 SVC_COMPONENT_ID - This token will resolve to the Service component Id. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\:SVC_COMPONENT_ID]
 RSC_PROVIDER_ID - This token will resolve to the Resource Provider Id that was selected at the Subscription time. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\:RSC_PROVIDER_ID]
 SVC_SUBSCRIPTION_EMAIL - This token will resolve to the subscriber’s email address. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\: SVC_SUBSCRIPTION_EMAIL]
 RSC_SUBSCRIPTION_ID - This token will resolve to the Resource Subscription Id that was created from the Resource Offering at the Subscription time.
  		Default value for this token is [TOKEN\: RSC_SUBSCRIPTION_ID]
 SVC_COMPONENT_TYPE - This token will resolve to the Service component type. Eg\: Server.. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\: SVC_COMPONENT_TYPE]
 RSC_POOL_ID - This token will resolve to the Resource pool Id that was selected at the Subscription time. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\: RSC_POOL_ID]
 SVC_INSTANCE_ID - This token will resolve to the Service Instance Id. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\: SVC_INSTANCE_ID]
 SVC_SUBSCRIPTION_ID - This token will resolve to the Subscription Id that was created at the Subscription time. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\: SVC_SUBSCRIPTION_ID]
 PRN_COMPONENT_ID – This token will resolve to the parent Component’s Service Component Id. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\: PRN_COMPONENT_ID]
 REQ_ORG_ID - This token will resolve to the Organization Id associated with the service request. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\: REQ_ORG_ID]
 REQ_USER_ID - This token will resolve to the User Id associated with the service request. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\: REQ_USER_ID]
 USR_ORG_ID - This token will resolve to the Organization Id associated with the subscriber. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\: USR_ORG_ID]
 RSC_BINDING_ID - This token will resolve to the Resource Binding Id that was created at the Subscription time. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\: RSC_BINDING_ID]

Responses\:
 success - The operation completed successfully.
 failure - Something went wrong.
72acb2c8-0fc4-4553-a2eb-1eaad8524939.e3ef27f1-4c57-49f2-9860-e70fbdee3130.prompt=Artifact ID 72acb2c8-0fc4-4553-a2eb-1eaad8524939.f2ea51bc-eb21-4378-a155-6548f3945564.prompt=User Identifier
flow.name: VPC - Start

step.name: Send Mail to Support for Start - Linux

staticBinding.value: MTC LNX: Start Server ${server.name}.${MTC/MTC-dns-domain} / ${vpcfqdn} - SECOND REMINDER

The below server was requested to be started via the portal.

Hostname: ${server.name}.${MTC/MTC-dns-domain}
Cloud Hostname: ${vpcfqdn}
CSA order ID: ${CSA_PROCESS_ID}
Private IP: ${server.privateIP}
Public IP: ${server.publicIP}

Carry out the following task within 2 hours:
Log ticket in ISC to start server specify:
Severity: P2
Hostname: ${vpcfqdn}
Ask team to notify DL when server started ${MTC/mtc-startlx-email}
Once server start confirmation received:
- Remove outage in ESL
- Inform requestor: ${server.email}

Your MTC request to start the below server has been received.



Hostname: ${server.name}
Public IP: ${server.publicIP}
CSA ID: ${SVC_SUBSCRIPTION_ID}

Please allow up to 3 business days for this task to be completed.



Regards,
The MTC Support Team

step.name: Send Mail to Support for Start - Windows

staticBinding.value: MTC WIN: Start Server ${server.name}.${MTC/MTC-dns-domain} / ${vpcfqdn} - SECOND REMINDER

The below server was requested to be started via the portal.

Hostname: ${server.name}.${MTC/MTC-dns-domain}
Cloud Hostname: ${vpcfqdn}
CSA order ID: ${CSA_PROCESS_ID}

Public IP: ${server.publicIP}

Hostname: ${vpcfqdn}
Ask team to notify DL when server started ${MTC/mtc-startmw-email}

Once server start confirmation received:
- Remove outage in ESL
- Inform requestor: ${server.email}
